reviewText:
Early Access Review

In the first hour I died over 600 times. That's an average of one death every 6 seconds.

- If you like Super Meat Boy, you will love this game.
- Singleplayer story contains Santa on a quest to kill Hitler, with special guest appearances by Jesus.
- Great local coop mode. Tons of modes.
- Local coop has a built in drinking game!
- Crazy addictive music. Couldn't find the song on YouTube, so I keep the game in window mode open in the background.

Perfect game for an evening of gaming and drinking with friends.

Rating: 600 / 10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Genre: 2D Platformer/Indie
Note: Copy provided by the developer/publisher for the purpose of beta testing.

This game has a singleplayer and right now only local multiplayer(it's still not known if that will change). It may not be clear enough on the store page, but the game is more multiplayer oriented. Gameplay in this game is pretty simple and pretty smooth. In singleplayer you can only jump and double jump. Landing on the small places can be a bit tricky at first, but it's not that hard to get used to it. Only addition in multiplayer is that you can shoot in some games.

Singleplayer
Singleplayer right now consists of only two worlds and it's called No Friends"(just saying so people don't get confused). Story is about Santa trying to save the world from swaggy Hitler
date: so it has funny moments. Every world has 12 levels
recommended: where levels 12 and 24 are bossfights. Levels in the first world are pretty short
hoursPlayed: usually not that hard to beat and same goes for the first bossfight. As for world 2
voteText: you can really see an improvement there
helpfulPercent: since levels are now better designed
votesTotal: and longer. There's one level in the world 2
votesFunny: that looks like Flappy Bird game
column16: so it's a bit different than real Flappy Bird and not that hard. Singleplayer also has "No Death Run" and "Speedrun" modes. I am not sure how many more worlds will be added since it's still an early access
column17: but from what I've heard singleplayer is just a bonus and right now it's pretty short. Takes between 2-2.5 hours to beat I would say since the second world is pretty hard
column18:
so you can get stuck somewhere for a while.


Multiplayer
Multiplayer is like I already said only local for now
column19: and it has pvp with 2-4 players. Right now it consists of 12 games. This is the list of games: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=527371719.\nYou can deselect the games that you don't want to play in a tournament. Before starting the tournament you need to select one of many characters that you want to play with: Santa
column21: etc. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=527396989\nand many of those characters can be unlocked by playing the story mode. When tournament starts
column22: games are selected random. In Battle Arena for example first who kills opponent 5 times wins
column23: in Trap Run first who reach the finish wins
column25: plus there's Duck Hunt- remember the game on Sega where you needed to shoot ducks
column27: except it's pvp. All in all multiplayer is pretty fun
column28: and playing with more people certanly makes it more fun and probably more confusing since the levels are not that big for now at least.\n\nVerdict: Decent game
column29: that is most fun when you play it with friends. Has singleplayer too right now
column30: however it's pretty short and consists of 2 worlds.\n\nPersonal rating: 7.5/10"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Played this as an actual drinking game last night - and it was a riot! I have a group that plays TowerFall and SpeedRunners like twice a week. We will try anything that supports major local co-op action. This game was a no brainer.

What is cool about this title is that the game modes are randomized for each round. One round may be a race, one may be a deathmatch, and yet another may be an obstacle course. The variety is great. Everything stays lite and accessible for newish players yet there is still some cool difficulty for old-school gamers. Here is a great example of how they accomplish this: there is a room with lots of spike hazards, and it is a race to the end. If you can get to the end without touching a single one - you can win it in one go, BUT if you touch a spike, it is removed, essentially making the run easier. You keep respawning infinitely after death.

Totally accessible game that is really fun for local co-op. I highly recommend.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Awesome game and amazing new concept to incorporate old childhood games into one new pixelated game specifically designed for multiplayer.
The game is still under development ofc (of course,for n00bs), so NEW and amazing content is to be expected.
Up until now I give it  10 out of 10  and 7 from my mom (for many reasons,this is my rating for now) since I already enjoyed it by playing the few Story Mode (aka NO FRIENDS XD ) levels and the MP levels.
No bugs encountered until now,and the only things I expect for the future and I reccomend from my personal opinion would be:
a lot of new multiplayer levels,to enjoy many random games,possibly with a few more configurations/settings like more rounds. Also,the deatmatch fighting arenas (yes,we need more ahah) would need some more  weapons and hazards,like the gramophone music,which is awesome.
Winning round/winning animations for the sprites would be interesting.
Some fancy descriptions for each achievement/colectibleThat's all I can say for now ;) Keep up the good work.
I totally reccomend it for some casual fun,specially the ol'Hitler story and the multiplayer drinking game lol.
I would also like to specially thank the developer for it's kindness and patience :3 Such people are rare to meet those days.
_-Flux

Early Access Review

It's so refreshing to not have to make up my own drinking game rules.

Even in early access (ver. 0. 3) it's a super fun party drinking game. Great format for it, brutal mini-games where degrees of success or failure result in a # of drinks to take after each one. LOVE. IT.

NOTE: Don't mess with the system. When it says take a drink, take *a drink*. Not a shot. We learned this the hard way when we first started playing.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

TL:DR Version - Fun!.

A fun and silly party game, no negitives unless you don't have friends to play with (tip: they can be found outside - your local pub maybe able to help).

There is a single player mode also which will drive you mad but you will have a lot of fun going mad at the same time.

The title music is awesome.

Personally i have this game setup on my PC connected to the TV and play with friends using xbox 360 controllers.

The game plays in rounds of quick fire mini games with the first player to reach 5 rounds the winner. There are pleanty of diffrent types for example a bomber man style level and flappy bird type game, and more coming all the time.

One man dev team, but done properly think Stardew, had a bug recently (not anything that should put anyone off) dev realised there was a bug, had a work around, replied to my bug report and other users within hours. If you buy this game (at time of writing at least) and it doesn't work for you straight away, don't be a norman and thumbs down tell the dev it will get read and replied too.

I'm crap at this compared to my friends and the drinking game mode may have led to mild alcoholism.

11/10 Would abuse liver again.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The best way I can think of describing 8Bit Fiesta as a 8-bit adult Mario Party game (without the game board).

While the game has some other features, the main portion of the game appears to focus on the local multiplayer mini games. This is the game's greatest strength at this point in Early Access. While the game doesn't have a lot of mini games at this time, I actually had quite a bit of fun with some of them. The other mini games were solid as well. If the developers continue to add mini games, I think 8Bit Fiesta could be a good game.

At this point 8Bit Fiesta is more of a multiplayer game than a single player game. 8Bit Fiesta does have a single player mode which is pretty typical platformer. I have played some of the single player and there is nothing wrong with it but there is also nothing special about it.

If you are looking exclusively for a single player game, at this time I don't think 8Bit Fiesta is worth it. If you are looking for an interesting local multiplayer party game though, I think 8Bit Fiesta could surprise you.

Note: I received a free review copy from the developer.

Read My Full Review [www.geekyhobbies.com]

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Introduction 8Bit Fiesta is a brutal platformer that will punish you when you make even the slightest mistake. It has  local co-op as well as a single player story line with some over the top humor. Play with your buddies, or all alone at home (like me ;~;)

The Good, and the BadPros:
-You can play as Santa
-Funny single player story line
-When you double jump, you fart
-Great party game
-Tons of character to choose from

Cons:
-Almost impossible to play with a keyboard (you will have to have a controller for this one)
-It is really hard (obviously meant to be this way)

My VerdictIf you need a fun game to play by yourself or with friends, this game fits the bill.
Still in early access, but looking foreward to see more coming in the future.
Difficult to play, near impossible to play perfectly.
8/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

♥♥♥♥ YOU, LL.
It took me a few days to write a review for this game, and I was making it as a curator for LL's game giveaway and review group, and LL thought I scammed him after him buying me the game to review it, blocked me, permabanned me from his group, and now thinks of me as disgraceful scum.

Okay, here I go, I guess...

8Bit Fiesta is a pixel die-hard game that forces you in to rage and confusion, in the likeness of Super Meat Boy or even Geometry Dash if you considered it.
It is a heavily multiplayer game, but I don't have any close (as in location) friends, so I've only played the singleplayer part of the game, thus I won't be talking about multiplayer.
There are 3 modes, and minigames-
Story Mode,
One Life / Hardcore,
and Speedrun.
They are all pretty self-explanatory, Story Mode is the full campaign with cutscenes and infinite lives.
Hardcore gives you one life to go thru the campaign with no cutscenes or even checkpoints.
Speedrun is the same as Story Mode, but gives you some tools to help beat the game as fast as possible, including a timer.
Each level is a good-sized platforming puzzle, esque Super Meat Boy as I stated above.
So far there are (I believe) 2 chapters / worlds with a bundle of cutscenes with plenty of jokes.
The minigames include (atleast in singleplayer), a flappy bird clone and a little zombie shooter... thing. Not much else to say.
The controls are supported on keyboard, but it is recommended that you play with a gamepad (again, like Super Meat Boy).
Honestly, there's not much more to say.
TL;DR Super Meat Boy x Alcohol.
8.7/10

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis is probably one of the best game purchase decisions I have ever made. Most games are either really fun at being single player, or multiplayer. This game manages to be amazingly fun either by yourself or with friends. I've played this game for hours by myself, and get excited as I pass each level to see the next challange and items being incorporated. During my birthday recently, a bunch of friends started playing this with me and we were all addicited. Even better, the developer seems to still be adding to this game, and also is very responsive to customers! I emailed him with a few bugs I found and a couple of suggestions my friends and I had recently, he verified the bugs and had them patched within a day or two. He also said he liked my ideas and would look into adding them in a future version. If you're on the fence about buying this game, hopefully this review helps make up your mind. Highly recommended!

8Bit Fiesta. What to say?

When I first sat down with this game I didn't know what to expect. Turns out it was the best thing ever, even tho as I am writing this wannabe review I have only played for about 40 minutes. The gameplay, at least singelplayer wise is very similar to Super Meat Boy, it's hard yet really fun and the story.. Well, we got Santa Clause chasing after Adolf Hitler. What more could you ask for? There is also minigames and multiplayer, Can't really speak for the multiplayer seeing as I haven't really tried it yet in my extremely long 40 minute playtime, but the minigames are great!

It's definitely worth a buy if you need ha fun, simple yet hard game to pass your time with!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is not just a drinking game anymore. It is a great party game with lots of content since when I first got it. There is a ton of stuff from minigames resembling mobile games to Nintendo games. For people looking for a great multiplayer/split screen experience you cannot go wrong with this game. Content is added regularly and yes there are bugs but for now that adds to the style of the game. But hopefully after early access it gets better. Can't wait to see where this game goes. I will probably have spent several hours with friends on it before it gets out of early access.
